dfischer.utils

Class CookieHandler

  • java.lang.Object
    • dfischer.utils.CookieHandler

  • public class CookieHandler
extends java.lang.Object
    Emulates a cookie handler of a Web browser. Used during executing a load test program for automatic cookie handling (per emulated user). This class interacts very close with the class HttpTestURL.

    Hint: for special cases it is also supported to create and add a cookie without receiving it from the Web server by using the method setCookie() or by using the predefined load test plug-in "Cookie Injector" at GUI level.

    See Also:
    HttpTestURL, Cookie, HtmlHeaderCookieExtractor

    • Constructor Summary

      Constructors 
      Constructor and Description
      CookieHandler()
      Creates a new, empty cookie handler.

      • setLogVectorInterface

        public void setLogVectorInterface(java.lang.Object logVectorObject)
        Supports debugging of the cookie handler.
        Parameters:
        logVectorObject - Object, which must implement the LogVectorInterface and that receives the debug output.
        See Also:
        LogVectorInterface

      • clearAll

        public void clearAll()
        Removes all cookies from the cookie handler.

      • clearCookie

        public void clearCookie(java.lang.String name)
        Removes a cookie from the cookie handler.
        Parameters:
        name - the name of the cookie

      • removeExpired

        public void removeExpired(boolean endOfSession)
        Removes (only) all expired cookies from the cookie handler.
        Parameters:
        endOfSession - if set to true: removes additionally all session cookies.

      • setCookie

        public void setCookie(Cookie cookie)
        Adds a new cookie to the cookie handler. If a same, duplicated, already stored cookie exists it will be replaced. Calls also removeExpired(false).
        Parameters:
        cookie - new cookie to add
        See Also:
        removeExpired(boolean)

      • setCookieNeverExpired

        public void setCookieNeverExpired(Cookie cookie)
        Caution/Internal: This method is called only to simulate the run-time environment of inline-scripts - do not call it during load test execution! Adds a new cookie to the cookie handler. If a same, duplicated, already stored cookie exists it will be replaced.
        Parameters:
        cookie - new cookie to add
        Since:
        V5.4-F

      • getCookie

        public Cookie getCookie(java.lang.String cookieName)
        Returns a cookie which is selected by its name.
        Parameters:
        cookieName - the name of the cookie
        Returns:
        the selected cookie, or null if no cookie with such a name was found.

      • getMatchList

        public java.util.Vector getMatchList(java.lang.String domain,
                            java.lang.String path,
                            boolean useSSL)
        Returns a list of all cookies that must be transferred back to the server on a HTTP request.
        Parameters:
        domain - domain of HTTP request (Example: "www.d-fischer.com")
        path - path of HTTP request (Example: "/")
        useSSL - if true: returns only cookies marked with the secure flag.
        Returns:
        List of cookies in form of (Cookie) java.util.Vector or a empty vector.
        See Also:
        Cookie

      • getHttpCookie

        public java.lang.String getHttpCookie(java.lang.String domain,
                             java.lang.String path,
                             boolean useSSL)
        Creates a HTTP header request line, which contains all cookies that must be transferred back to the web server.
        Parameters:
        domain - domain of HTTP request
        path - path of HTTP request
        useSSL - if true: adds only cookies marked with the secure flag
        Returns:
        HTTP header request line which contains the cookies.
        See Also:
        getMatchList(java.lang.String, java.lang.String, boolean)

      • dumpAllCookies

        public void dumpAllCookies(java.io.PrintStream dumpStream)
        Supports debugging of the cookie handler.
        Parameters:
        dumpStream - PrintStream, to which a list of all collected cookies will be written.

      • dumpSelectedCookies

        public void dumpSelectedCookies(java.io.PrintStream dumpStream,
                       java.lang.String domain,
                       java.lang.String path,
                       boolean useSSL)
        Supports debugging of the cookie handler. Emulates a HTTP Request.
        Parameters:
        dumpStream - PrintStream, to which a list of all matched cookies will be written.
        domain - domain of cookies (selection criteria)
        path - path of cookies (selection criteria)
        useSSL - if true: select only cookies marked with the secure flag

      • main

        public static void main(java.lang.String[] args)
        Internal test program.
